title: crowbar
body:
A hooked or curved steel bar that used as an [[tools|tool]] to open locked, closed or other inaccessible object, usually [[crate]]s or [[door]]s made of wood or metal, or demolish items and structure, like sledgehammer. it has two flat claws on both ends to pry the object open, its "teeth" the gap on the claw of its hooked end (hooked end is also known as the crowbar "heel") is used as an physical space for prying [[nail (hardware)|]] out of wooden [[plank]]. 

Signature weapon of [[Gordon Freeman]] of the [[Half-life (series)|]] series and [[Nyarlathotep (Nyaruko-san)|Nyarlathotep]] of [[Haiyore! Nyaruko-san]].

title: yamagumo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Yamagumo[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Horie Yui]].

She has [[long_hair|long]], [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[grey hair]] tied into a [[single braid]], and [[grey eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Fujikawa-design [i]Asashio[/i]-class uniform: a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[green bowtie]], [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt]] with [[suspenders]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[bike shorts]], [[black socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge, funnel, and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]], [[depth charge]]s dangling from her left suspender, and 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on her right leg [[thigh strap]].

title: where's_the_cat?_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]]tic [[3koma]] comic format originated from a comic by [[Deadnooodles]]. It involves the "victim" being offered to show a [[cat]] by the "predator". After they have entered the room, the predator locks the door behind them.

Then, the victim asks where is the cat, the predator [[whispering|whispered]] "meow" (or its derivative), much to their horror as they realized that they are now [[you gonna get raped|trapped together]].

h4. Origins
* !post #4637318: Original
* !post #4976342: Popular version

title: fujimaru_ritsuka_(female)
body:
The protagonist of [[Fate/Grand Order]] if selected as female.

She has [[orange hair]], [[orange eyes]] and an [[ahoge]]. In her default attire which is [[Chaldea uniform]], she has a [[side ponytail]]/[[one side up]] tied by a yellow [[hair scrunchie]], and wears a [[black skirt]], [[black pantyhose]] and a pair of [[white_footwear|white]] [[boots]].

She has roughly the same characterization as the [[fujimaru_ritsuka_(male)|male version]]. She does, however, have an alternate characterization from the "Learn with Manga!" (pool #10385) comics, where she is more depraved and quick to [[female pervert|perv]] on other female Servants, particularly [[Mash Kyrielight]].

The [[fujimaru ritsuka (male)|male protagonist]] is colloquially called Gudao. The name Gudako could come from an abbreviation of [b]Gu[/b]rando Oo[b]da[/b]a, or from "Gudaguda Order" (ぐだぐだオーダー), an official series of Grand Order comics 
("English":[http://fate-go.us/gudao/], "Japanese":[https://www.fate-go.jp/gudao/]). Ko is a common ending for female names and can also mean girl.

Her appearance is based on [[Emiya Shirou]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Sekine Akira]]

title: fujimaru_ritsuka_(male)
body:
The protagonist of [[Fate/Grand Order]] if selected as male.

He has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[blue eyes]]. Usually seen wearing a [[Chaldea uniform]].

As he is a player character, he does not have much characterization within the game itself. However, he receives more personality in manga and anime adaptations. He also makes cameo appearances in the [i]Learn With Manga![/i] series, where he regularly makes passes at [[Astolfo (fate)|]] and is apparently the [[fujimaru_ritsuka_(female)|female protagonist]]'s pretend pro-wrestling partner.

His appearance is based on [[Tohsaka Rin]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Shimazaki Nobunaga]]

title: just_the_two_of_us_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originated from a YouTube clip of the 1981 song "Just the Two of Us" by Glover Washington Jr. with no modifications except a static frame of a real person paired with an anime character in [[monochrome]].

The first instance inset an anime screencap render of [[Fujiwara Chika]] with standing beside a [[photo background]] of [[Thomas Shelby]].

It later spawned numerous variants, such as the one featuring two cats and the deepfake version featuring an [[alien]] singing the song.

h4. Examples

* !post #6195866

h4. See also

* pool #1499: The Most Unlikely Couples

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/just-the-two-of-us]

title: kamui_gakupo
body:
Camui Gackpo (or Kamui Gakupo) is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Internet Co., Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. 

Licensed as Gackpoid (がくっぽいど), he is voiced by singer, songwriter, and actor, GACKT. His appearance was illustrated by [[Miura Kentarou]], the creator of [[Berserk]]. His design is reminiscent of a [[samurai]] (with katakana included). He wears [[Japanese clothes|Japanese style clothing]] over a [[bodysuit]]. He has [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]] pulled into a [[ponytail]].

h4. Official art

* !post #269006
* !post #443345

h4. See also

* [[Kamui Gakupo (V3 Gackpoid)]]
* [[List of VOCALOID derivatives]]

title: million_dreams_(idolmaster)
body:
Million Dreams is a [[LUXURY (idolmaster)|]] costume that primarily appears in the Million Live! brand. It was introduced in THE iDOLM@STER Million Live!. It has made subsequent appearances in the following 2nd Vision games, and the costume is used in THE iDOLM@STER Million Live! Theater Days as the costume for N+ card illustrations.

Although it is mainly associated with Million Live!, Million Dreams has appeared in the main games as well. The first time it appeared in a home console game was the PlayStation 3 version of THE iDOLM@STER 2, where it can be obtained from the game's eighteenth DLC catalog. It also appeared in THE iDOLM@STER ONE FOR ALL, where it is a base game costume that can be purchased in-game for 96,000 money at Lucky Rabbit.

h4. External links

* "project-imas wiki":https://project-imas.wiki/Million_Dreams

body:
Pink apollo (ピンクアポロ) is a coloration of the [[cosmic & funny (idolmaster)|]] costume set from THE iDOLM@STER. It is pink and white with small amounts of red. Most of the see-through material is light green and the blinking lights are blue. The pink parts are frequently miscolored as being purple. Pink apollo is most commonly seen on Iori as it is(mostly) pink, her theme color. Pink apollo is actually the main cosmic & funny coloration but ever since inflation bran was used for the box art of THE iDOLM@STER Live For You!, inflation bran is most commonly used.

title: heavily_armed_high_school_girls
body:
[i]Juuheisou-gata Joshikousei:[/i] a series of illustrations by [[neco]] depicting girls (all named after numbers in Japanese or German) with futuristic weapons and combat gear. Some characters from this series have been adapted as [[figma]]. The characters sometimes wear clothing with a logo that says H.A.H.G.S. rather than H.A.H.S.G., which may be considered an example of [[Engrish text]].

h4. Characters

* [[Ichi (neco)|]] (ash-blonde hair, green eyes, 3 swords)
* [[Ni (neco)|]] (light blue hair, blue and red [[heterochromia]], 2 submachine guns)
* [[San (neco)|]] (blonde hair, red eyes, [[eyepatch]], 4 axes)
* [[Shi (neco)|]] (white hair with red tips, red eyes, 4 swords)
* [[Go (neco)| ]] (black hair, brown eyes, 6 knives)
* [[Roku (neco)|]] (grey hair, grey eyes, bow and arrows)
* [[Null (neco)|]] (grey hair, brown eyes, tanned, 6 swords or 4 gatling guns)
* [[Eins (neco)|]] (brown hair, brown eyes, scythe)
* [[Zwei (neco)|]] (white hair, purple eyes, buster sword)
* [[Drei (neco)|]] (blonde hair, yellow eyes, mace)

h4. See also
* [[Arms Note]], a similar series by [[Fukai Ryosuke]] with more emphasis on firearms.

title: louisiana
body:
Use for posts referencing the [[United States|US]] state of Louisiana. 

Louisiana (French: Louisiane; Louisiana Creole: Lwizyàn) is a state in the Southern [[United States|United States of America]]. Its counties are called parishes (French: Paroisses; Creole: pawas). The state borders [[Texas]] to the west, [[Arkansas]] to the north, and [[Mississippi]] to the east. Its capital is Baton Rouge and its largest city is [[New Orleans]] (French: Nouvelle-Órleans; Creole: Nouvèl Orleans)

Famous foods of Louisiana are Gumbo, jambalaya, crawfish boil, king cake (French: gallette des rois), beignets, étoufée, and boudin. One famous holiday   that Louisiana is heavily associated with in the public consciousness is [[Mardi Gras]] (Fat Tuesday) which is celebrated in late winter/early spring.

h4. See Also

* [[Voodoo]]
* [[Quebec]]

h4. External Links 
* "Wikipedia: Louisiana":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louisiana]

title: gumi_(ai_megpoid)
body: [[GUMI]]'s [[Vocaloid|VOCALOID6]] voicebank, with design illustrated by [[nou (nounknown)]]. She is the first non-standard vocal on the V6 engine and was announced together at the same as VOCALOID6 on October 13, 2022. Her design is similar to her previous Vocaloid designs with [[red goggles]], [[orange jacket]], [[yellow shirt]], [[green tube top]], and [[layered skirt|layered]] orange and green skirt. Her headphones and belt are inspired by the Yamaha TENORI-ON instrument and her clothing have a 6 motif (6 folds in the jacket, 6 arches of the upper skirt, 6 pleats of the lower skirt) in celebration of the release of VOCALOID6. Her later [[Gumi (SV)|Synthesizer V voicebank]] borrows the same design, but with her goggles, brooch, and belt being blue instead of red and green. h4. Official art * !post #5745913: Default * !post #5745915: Reference sheet * !post #7674898: SOLID h4. See also * [[List of VOCALOID derivatives]]

title: yukihana_lamy_(casual)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Yukihana Lamy]].

Her casual attire consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[white sailor collar]], a [[black bowtie]] and [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[grey cardigan|grey]] [[cable knit]] cardigan, a [[brown dress|brown]] [[plaid dress|plaid]] [[pleated dress|pleated]] [[medium dress|medium]] [[pinafore dress]] with [[frills]], [[black socks]], and [[white boots|white]] [[fold-over boots]]. She also has optional [[cat ears]] and an optional [[white capelet|white]] [[rabbit hood|rabbit]] [[hooded capelet]].

For her 3rd anniversary she got an optional [[cable knit]] [[fur-trimmed capelet]] with a [[white bowtie]] and am additional hairstyle.

title: we_can_do_it!
body:
A [[World War II]] [[propaganda]] [[poster (medium)|]] by artist J. Howard Miller, depicting a muscular young woman in a work shirt and kerchief flexing her right biceps.

The poster was created to inspire factory workers at Westinghouse Electric (many of whom, like U.S. war workers generally, were women, due to the pressure places on the male workforce by the military draft).

The poster is often said to depict [[Rosie the Riveter]], and to have been used to recruit more women into the war production effort. Neither legend is true. Miller did not intend the poster to depict [[Rosie the Riveter]], nor was it used for general recruiting. Rather, its purpose was to exhort women (and men) who already worked for Westinghouse to work harder; the woman depicted in the poster is even wearing a Westinghouse employee badge on her shirt collar.

h4. Examples

* !asset #22620458

h4. See also

* [[Rosie the Riveter]]

title: slugcat
body:
The playable character species of the game [[Rain World]].

Salient qualities are smooth, monochromatic skin with [[solid eyes]], a thick tail, and a capability to carry and use tools such as spears.

The base game has three different playable slugcats:
* [[Survivor (rain world)|]] ([b]white[/b]) - The baseline experience. Survivor has no special attributes and average stats.
* [[Monk (rain world)|]] ([b]yellow[/b]) - Slightly decreases the difficulty level. The game is otherwise the same.
* [[Hunter (rain world)|]] ([b]pink[/b]) - [i]Greatly[/i] increases the difficulty. The game is also changed significantly, with both the player's start position and the end goal being different. [spoiler]Hunter's campaign chronologically takes place before Survivor's and Monk's.[/spoiler]

The "Downpour" DLC adds five more playable slugcats, all with unique campaigns, plus one secret slugcat. The game world also undergoes changes between campaigns, sometimes slightly, sometimes tremendously.
* [[Artificer (rain world)|]] ([b]maroon[/b]) - Pyrotechnic master, hates Scavengers. [spoiler]Takes place sometime before Hunter.[/spoiler]
* [[Gourmand (rain world)|]] ([b]orange[/b]) - A more... rotund slugcat than most. [spoiler]Takes place between Hunter and Survivor.[/spoiler]
* [[Spearmaster (rain world)|]] ([b]purple[/b], with white spots on tail) - Can produce spears on demand. Has no mouth. [spoiler]Takes place far before any other campaign in the timeline[/spoiler]
* [[Rivulet (rain world)|]] ([b]light blue[/b], with [[axolotl]]-like appendages) - Runs and swims extremely fast. They'll need it. [spoiler]Takes place a significant amount of time after Survivor's campaign[/spoiler]
* [[Saint (rain world)|]] ([b]green[/b]) - Nonviolent, vegetarian, and more than what they seem. [spoiler]Takes place far in the future, with a radically altered environment[/spoiler]
* [[Inv (rain world)|]] ([b]black[/b]) - Secret slugcat. More or less a joke, as their campaign contains various fourth-wall breaking elements and the difficulty is ramped to absurd levels. On the plus side, they start with a [[singularity bomb (rain world)|]]. [spoiler]Their campaign ends with a dating simulator.[/spoiler]

The upcoming (March 2025) DLC "The Watcher" adds the titular slugcat:
* [[Watcher (rain world)|]] ([b]navy blue[/b]) - unknown

title: santa_costume
body:
A [[Santa Claus]]-themed outfit. This involves prominent use of red fabric with white trim on the edges. As such, many types of clothing can be used in this style - swimsuits, undergarments, outerwear etc. A wide, black belt may be present.

Due to the many variations on this costume in different cultures through history, it should be noted that although red is the most popular color used in "Santa costumes" on Danbooru, it is [i]not the only[/i] color associated with "Santa." See below for alternate tagged colors.

Use the [[Santa hat]] tag when the majority of a character's clothing is not Santa-themed except for the hat.

Images with the actual Santa Claus character should be tagged with [[Santa Claus]].

title: kaname_madoka
body:
The protagonist of [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]].

Her [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]] is tied into [[short twintails|pigtails]]. She also has [[pink eyes]].

In her daily life, she typically wears the [[Mitakihara school uniform]] paired with [[white thighhighs|white]] [[thighhighs]] and [[red ribbon|red]] or [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[ribbon]]s [[hair ribbon|in her hair]].

As a [[Magical Girl]], she wears [[pink bow|pink]] [[hair bow|hair]] [[bow]]s, a [[red choker|red]] [[bow choker]], a [[pink gemstone|pink]] [[chest jewel]], a [[short dress|short]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[dress]] with a [[square neckline]], [[puffy short sleeves|puffy short]] [[white sleeves]], a [[petticoat]], [[buttons]] and a [[heart cutout]] at the [[back cutout|back]], [[white gloves|white]] [[gloves]], a [[miniskirt|short]] [[white skirt|white]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[bubble skirt]], [[frilled socks|frilled]] [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]] and [[red shoes|red]] [[pumps]] with [[footwear_bow|straps]]. She fights using a [[bow (weapon)|]] and [[arrow (projectile)|]]s.

Her [[voice actor|voice actresses]] are none other than [[Yuuki Aoi]] (Japanese) and [[Christine Marie Cabanos]] (English).

h4. See also

title: a-chan_(hololive)
body:
[b]Yuujin A[/b] (lit. "Friend A"), better known as [b]A-chan[/b] (Ei-chan), is a former (as of "the end of June 2024":[https://twitter.com/achan_UGA/status/1806583319725039822]) [[hololive]] staff member and director.

She has [[aqua eyes|aqua]] or [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] with [[swept bangs]], a large [[blue bow|blue]] [[hair bow]], and [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[glasses]].

Despite not officially being a [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]] herself, she is a popular character in the hololive fandom, which reached the point that she eventually gained her own VTuber model (designed by [[Amagai Tarou]]). She used it to host various collab and announcement streams on the main hololive YouTube channel.

Her name refers to her status as a personal friend of [[Tokino Sora]], though she had never been a manager of her or any other hololive member.

title: guitar
body:
A plucked stringed [[instrument]], either [[electric guitar|electric]] or [[acoustic guitar|acoustic]], with a long neck.

Closely related to the [[bass guitar]] except that a standard guitar typically has [b]six strings[/b] and six tuning pegs at the top of the neck. On rare occasions a guitar may have more strings than that (e.g. 12).

Do not tag [[bass guitar]]s as regular guitars. A bass guitar has four strings, while a regular guitar has six.

h4. Examples

body:

As designed, she sports [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with an [[ahoge]], and dark [[pink eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a [[collared shirt|buttoned]] [[white shirt]], a [[green cardigan]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]] typical of an [[office lady]] type, [[pantyhose]], and [[high heels]]. She also wears a pink-colored [[lanyard]] that holds her [[ID card]] with her portrait and name on it as well as a [[frog]] [[charm (object)|accessory]].

She also has a [[mole on neck|mole on her neck]], although the official art makes it hard to spot from a distance.

body:

Some of the characters originally appeared in the [[Madou Monogatari]] series of games, as it is a spinoff from that series.

title: kagamine_len
body:
Kagamine Len is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Crypton Future Media, Inc., and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. He is the second of the Character Vocal Series together with [[Kagamine Rin]] and is an official [[Piapro Studio|PIAPRO]] character.

He is voiced by seiyuu, [[Shimoda Asami]]. He is originally designed and illustrated by [[Kei (Keigarou)|KEI]] for his V2 voicebank. His V4X voicebank follows a similar outfit with readjustments designed and illustrated by [[iXima]].

He has [[blonde hair]] done in a [[short ponytail]] and [[blue eyes]]. He wears a [[sailor collar]] shirt with [[bass clef]] print and [[necktie]]. He wears [[shorts]] along with [[detached sleeves]], [[leg warmers]] and a white [[headset]].

His counterpart is Kagamine Rin. Their relationship (whether they are [[siblings]], lovers, etc) is officially left ambiguous and left up to the user to decide.

h4. Official art

* !post #164844: VOCALOID2 [[kagamine len (act1)|Act1]]
* !post #4921833: VOCALOID2 Act2
* !post #804549: [[kagamine len (append)|Append]]
* !post #2534193: [[kagamine len (vocaloid4)|V4X]]
* !post #7936765: [[Kagamine Len (SP)|SUPER PACK]]

h4. See also

* [[Magical Mirai Len]]
* [[Sakura Len]]
* [[Yuki Len]]
* [[List of VOCALOID derivatives]]

h4. External links

* "Official page":https://ec.crypton.co.jp/pages/prod/virtualsinger/cv02

title: kagamine_rin
body:
Kagamine Rin is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Crypton Future Media, Inc., and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. She is the second of the Character Vocal Series together with [[Kagamine Len]] and is an official [[Piapro Studio|PIAPRO]] character.

She is voiced by seiyuu, [[Shimoda Asami]]. She is originally designed and illustrated by [[Kei (Keigarou)|KEI]] for her V2 voicebank. Her V4X voicebank follows a similar outfit with readjustments designed and illustrated by [[iXima]].

She has [[blonde hair]] done in a short hair style and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[sailor collar]] shirt with [[treble clef]] print. She wears [[shorts]] along with [[detached sleeves]], [[leg warmers]] and a large [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]] connected on a white [[headset]].

Her counterpart is Kagamine Len. Their relationship (whether they are [[siblings]], lovers, etc) is officially left ambiguous and left up to the user to decide.

title: shiratsuyu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Shiratsuyu[/i]. Character design by [[Kujou Ichiso]], voiced by [[Tanibe Yumi]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with an [[orange hairband]] ([[red hairband|red]] after her first remodel), and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the [i]Shiratsuyu[/i]-class' [[school uniform]]: a [[black serafuku]], [[black socks]], and brown [[loafers]].

Her [[rigging]] at base form consists of a 12.7 cm twin gun mount slung to the side, a second 12.7 cm single mount [[handgun]], and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s.

title: kawakaze_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Kawakaze[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]]. Character design by [[Kujou Ichiso]], voiced by [[Ishigami Shizuka]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[red hair]] tied into [[low twintails]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is a modified version of the class' [[black serafuku]] with [[detached sleeves]], featuring a large white stripe on the front of the blouse, [[blue neckerchief]], [[black_skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[mary janes]]. 

She has a fiery "delinquent girl" / [[sukeban]] personality.

title: shouhou_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light carrier [i]Shouhou[/i]. Character design by [[Bob (biyonbiyon)|]], voiced by [[Taneda Risa]]. 

She has [[low-tied_long_hair|low-tied long]] [[black hair]] with a longer sidelock similarly tied low (these are frequently misinterpreted as being twintails), [[ahoge]], [[brown eyes]], and [[medium breasts]]. She wears a [[white kimono]] top worn [[hadanugi dousa]]-style, a [[bandeau]], red [[tasuki]], a [[black_skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[hakama short skirt]], and [[brown thighhighs]] patterned off her real-life flight deck. 

She has an earnest, but nervous personality, possibly related to how she sank before she was capable of proving herself in battle. Her lines refer to eagerly wanting to prove her worth or worrying that she isn't worthy.

h4. Appearance

title: furutaka_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Furutaka[/i]. Character design by [[Ugume]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with [[hair intakes]], and [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] eyes ([[yellow eyes|yellow]] on her left, [[brown eyes|brown]] on her right). Her left eye [[glowing eye|glows]] or emits sparks, representing her searchlights. Her default outfit is a [[serafuku]] style composed of a [[white shirt]] with [[blue sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[asymmetrical legwear]] ([[black socks|black sock]] on her left, [[black thighhighs|black thighhigh]] on her right), and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is mechanical in theme and consists of her real-life bridge and foremast on her right shoulder, two 20.3 cm twin gun mounts on her right arm, a funnel and a third 20.3 cm twin mount on her left shoulder, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on her left leg.

h4. Appearance

title: arashi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Arashi[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Kayano Ai]].

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[messy_hair|messy]] [[red hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[yellow eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Her default outfit is the Konishi-designed [i]Kagerou[/i]-class standard uniform: a [[white shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] with a [[black vest]], and a [[red neckerchief]]. She also wears a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white gloves]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[loafers]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her bridge on a backpack rig with a 12.7 cm twin mount on the right side and 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on the left, an additional 12.7 cm twin mount as a [[handgun]], a [[depth charge]] rack on her left leg [[thigh strap]], and a searchlight plus 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] mounts on her belt. 

The historical IJN [i]Arashi[/i] bears the dubious distinction of contributing to the crushing Japanese defeat at the [[Battle of Midway]] by inadvertently leading American planes to the Japanese fleet. She was sunk in a night action in August 1943.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2182574: Base

title: tales_of_phantasia
body:
The first game of the [b][i][[tales of (series)|Tales Series]][/i][/b] line.  Initially released on the [[super nintendo|Super Famicom]] in 1995, it has been ported and updated on several consoles, the latest being in conjunction with [[Tales of Phantasia: Narikiri Dungeon X]] for the [[Playstation Portable]]. It was finally localized in 2006 on the [[Game Boy Advance]], with dubious results. It also has fan translations for the Super Famicom and [[Playstation 1|PSX]] versions.

title: mechanic
body:
A person who uses [[tools]] to build, maintain, or [[repairing|repair]] [[machinery]], [[vehicle]]s like [[car]]s or [[truck]]s, or [[military]] equipment like [[tank]]s or [[mecha]]s.

title: yuubari_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Yuubari[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Bridcutt Sarah Emi]].

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] dull [[green hair]] in a [[ponytail]] secured with a teal [[hair bow]], and [[brown eyes]]. She wears a dark [[blue shirt|blue]] [[sailor shirt]] with a light [[green sailor collar]], [[orange neckerchief]], [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. In the [[Kantai Collection (anime)|Kantai Collection anime]] she also serves as the fleet's [[mechanic]] (due to the absence of [[Akashi (kancolle)|]]) and wears an alternate outfit consisting of an [[orange jumpsuit]] over a [[tank top]]. 

Her [[rigging]] at base form consists of two hull pieces held by the funnel-and-bridge to her back, with all four of her 14 cm twin/single mounts controlled by [[joystick]]s, and two 61 cm twin [[torpedo tubes]] on her ankles. 

As the real life [i]Yuubari[/i] was small in size and displacement (being slightly larger than the [i][[Akizuki (kancolle)|]][/i]-class destroyer), she is depicted with a petite body and costume akin to that of the other destroyer in-game. She is heavily associated with [[melon]]s (more specifically, [[cantaloupe]]s), due to her namesake city in Hokkaido being famous for cantaloupes.

Because the historical [i]Yuubari[/i] was built as an experimental ship to test new designs and configuration, Yuubari is very often portrayed tinkering with or designing new equipment, frequently together with [[Akashi (kancolle)|]]. Historically, [i]Yuubari[/i]'s survivors were rescued by [[Samidare (kancolle)|]], so the two are commonly depicted together, often in a big sister/little sister or romantic relationship.

title: chitose_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light carrier [i]Chitose[/i]. Character design by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Miyakawa Wakana]]. 

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[grey hair]] in a [[ponytail]], [[grey eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit is shared with her sister [[Chiyoda (Kancolle)|]]: a [[white shirt|white]] [[blouse]], [[red skirt|red]] [[hakama short skirt]], [[black jacket|black]] [[cropped jacket]] with a gold phoenix pattern, [[black pantyhose]], [[headband]], [[rudder footwear]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. 

Her [[rigging]] varies across her seaplane tender and light carrier forms. As a seaplane tender, she uses [[dual wielding|two]] [[aircraft catapult]]s and 12.7 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]] mounts, plus [[Type A Kou-hyouteki]] midget submarines at "A" form. As a light carrier, she goes for a [[flight deck]] theatre, with her identifier (Chiyo) marked on it. She controls her planes with [[puppet strings]]. 

She has a mellow and easy going personality. She can be quite doting towards the [[Admiral (kancolle)|]] and is often looking out for her younger sister, [[Chiyoda (Kancolle)|]]. She's fond of [[alcohol]], particularly [[sake]]. She's often depicted drinking with [[Jun'you (Kancolle)|]] and the other drunkards in the fleet.

title: amagiri_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Amagiri[/i]. Character design by [[Drew (drew213g)|]], voiced by [[Suzuki Minori]]. She has [[very_long_hair|very long]] [[grey hair]] tied in a [[ponytail]], [[grey eyes]], and [[glasses]]. Her default outfit is a variant of the Special-Type uniform unique to her and [[Sagiri (Kancolle)|]]: a [[white shirt]] with light [[blue sailor collar]], [[purple neckerchief]], [[black bodysuit]], [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. In her [[Amagiri Kai Ni (Kancolle)|Kai Ni]] form, she has well-defined [[abs]]. Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the Special-Types: her funnel and foremast to her back, a 12.7 twin [[handgun]] mount, and 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s She has a "hotblooded" [[tomboy]] personality, and seems to relish combat. Her lines reference her being taken care of by her younger sister-ship [[Sagiri (Kancolle)|]], who was implemented at the same time. She also makes occasional references to [[John F. Kennedy]] in her lines on account of her history with him. The historic IJN [i]Amagiri[/i] saw action in [[battle of Midway]], Eastern Solomons, the Tokyo Express transport missions, and Kula Gulf before she was sunk off Borneo in 1944 during a transport run. Her most famous action was the sinking of [i]PT-109[/i], an American torpedo boat that happened to carry future-President of the United States [[John F. Kennedy]]. h4. title: chiyoda_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light carrier [i]Chiyoda[/i]. Character design by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Miyakawa Wakana]]. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit is shared with her sister [[Chitose (Kancolle)|]]: a [[white shirt|white]] [[blouse]], [[red skirt|red]] [[hakama short skirt]], [[black jacket|black]] [[cropped jacket]] with a gold phoenix pattern, [[black pantyhose]], [[headband]], [[rudder footwear]], and [[brown shoes|brown]] [[loafers]]. 

Her [[rigging]] varies across her seaplane tender and light carrier forms. As a seaplane tender, she uses [[dual wielding|two]] [[aircraft catapult]]s and 12.7 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]] mounts, plus [[Type A Kou-hyouteki]] midget submarines at "A" form. As a light carrier, she goes for a [[flight deck]] theatre, with her identifier (Chito) marked on it. She controls her planes with [[puppet strings]]. 

She is depicted as being a [[siscon]] towards her elder sister, [[Chitose (Kancolle)|]]. She's fond of roasted [[sweet potato]]es. She seems to have a one sided friendly rivalry with the [[Admiral (Kancolle)|]] for her elder sister's affections, though she secretly harbors warm feelings toward the Admiral herself.

title: minazuki_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Minazuki[/i]. Character design by [[Kusada Souta]], voiced by [[Hidaka Rina]].

She has [[asymmetrical_hair|asymmetrical]] [[blue hair]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[black shirt]] with [[black sailor collar]], [[crescent pin]] on a [[blue necktie]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] with white stripes, and [[grey footwear|grey shoes]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back, a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on her ankles. 

She has a cheerful, yet somewhat soft-spoken, and highly feminine personality.  Her official lines have her interacting more with [[satsuki (kancolle)|Satsuki]] and [[Fumizuki (kancolle)|]], both of which, along with [[nagatsuki (kancolle)|Nagatsuki]], were part of DesDiv 22 with the historical [i]Minazuki[/i].

title: tamanami_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Tamanami[/i]. Character design by [[Fujikawa]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]], [[yellow eyes]], and a [[mole on neck|mole on the left side of her neck]]. She wears her hair [[swept bangs|swept toward her right side]], exposing her [[forehead]]. She wears the standard [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class uniform: a purple [[halterneck]] [[pleated dress]] over a [[white shirt]], [[blue bowtie]], and [[grey pantyhose]] with a pair of [[lace-up boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is the same as the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s.  

Her [[abyssal ship|abyssal]] form is assumed to be the [[Abyssal Jade Princess]].

title: fukae_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Fukae[/i]. Character design by [[Akasaka Yuzu]]. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] with [[blue hair|light blue]] [[gradient_hair|gradient tips]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is the [i]Etorofu[/i]-class uniform: a [[white shirt]] with a [[blue sailor collar]], [[aqua neckerchief]], [[black bodysuit]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[loafers]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her funnel and masts to her back, a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount, 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] and [[depth charge]]s on [[thigh strap]]s, additional depth charges on her belt, an [[anchor]] with ankle [[chain]], and a [[blue ribbon|blue ankle ribbon]].

She is named after "Fukue Island":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fukue_Island] (known as [i]Fukae[/i] during WWII), the southernmost of the Gotou Islands in Nagasaki Prefecture which are part of the city of Gotou.

title: food_on_toes
body:
Characters hold food (cherries, biscuits, etc.) in their toes, so please don't confuse this with the chocolate_on_foot and food_on_foot concepts. The former is chocolate or a black reflective liquid (if white please consider using cum, cream or sugestive_fluid) and the latter is food (cake, etc.) stuck or placed on the character's foot. If it's just chocolate or food on the foot, don't use food_on_toes.

h4. See also:
* [[Toe grab]]

title: hirato_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese escort ship [i]Hirato[/i]. Character design by [[Akasaka Yuzu]]. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[gradient_hair|gradient tips]], and [[brown eyes]] with [[glasses]]. Her default outfit is the [i]Etorofu[/i]-class uniform: a [[white shirt]] with a [[blue sailor collar]], [[aqua neckerchief]], [[white gloves]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[loafers]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the class: her funnel and masts to her back, a 12 cm [[handgun]] mount, 25 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]] and [[depth charge]]s on [[thigh strap]]s, additional depth charges slung to her side, an [[anchor]] with ankle [[chain]], and a [[blue ribbon|blue ankle ribbon]]. 

As a coastal defense ship, her class is even smaller than destroyers, and as such, she is portrayed as an "elementary school student" character, even younger than the generally "middle school" appearances of the destroyers. However, Hirato comes off looking like a old woman and her somewhat soft-spoken demeanor seems to further support this.

The historical ship was completed on September 28th, 1943 and sunk by USS Growler (SS-215) on September 12th, 1944 in the South China Sea.

title: scirocco_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Italian destroyer [i]Scirocco[/i]. Character design by [[Jiji (Aardvark)|]], voiced by [[Taketatsu Ayana]].

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[grey hair|grey]] [[gradient hair|gradient ends]] in [[two side up]] and a [[braid]], [[black eyes]], and a [[mole under eye|mole under her right eye]]. Her default outfit is the class' uniform: a [[sleeveless]] [[white dress|white]] [[sailor dress]] with her real-life hull code, striped [[red neckerchief]] with an [[anchor]] clip, and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast to her back, connecting her two 53.3 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] and 120 mm twin gun mounts, [[paravane]]s on [[thigh strap]]s, and her real-life fire control director as a [[mini hat]]. 

Like several others, she is also a victim of [[name connection]] jokes before her full reveal, in her case being associated with [[Paptimus Scirocco]] (especially the [[watermelon bar]] [[Waverider Crash]] reference), [[Blackwing Sirocco the Dawn]], and the [[Volkswagen]] Scirocco.

title: sagiri_(kancolle)
body: [[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Sagiri[/i]. Character design by [[Drew (drew213g)|]], voiced by [[Suzuki Minori]]. She has [[long_hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with [[swept bangs]], [[purple eyes]], and a [[blue hairband]] with a [[blue bow]]. Her default outfit is a variant of the Special-Type uniform unique to her and Amagiri: a [[white shirt]] with light [[blue sailor collar]], [[purple neckerchief]], [[black bodysuit]], [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white socks]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] is shared with the rest of the Special-Types: her funnel and foremast to her back, a 12.7 twin [[handgun]] mount, and 61 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. Sagiri, in contrast to her older sister [[Amagiri (Kancolle)|]], is portrayed as soft-spoken and highly "girly". Her voice lines portray her as lacking confidence and easily panicking upon being damaged (or when poked by Amagiri). She and Amagiri both have lines implying that Sagiri enjoys [[cooking]] for Amagiri and others. The historic IJN [i]Sagiri[/i] was torpedoed and sunk only three weeks into the war. About half her hands were lost, with the survivors being picked up by sister-ship [[Shirakumo_(kancolle)|]]. Her long grey hair gives her a [[look-alike|striking resemblance]] to [[name connection|namesake]] [[Izumi Sagiri]] from [[Eromanga Sensei]]. h4. title: ooi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Ooi[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her base outfit, shared with her sister [[Kitakami (Kancolle)|]], is composed of a [[green shirt]] with a [[green sailor collar]], [[black neckerchief]], [[green skirt|green]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black socks]] with white stripes, and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. 

Her base [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and foremast to her back, a 14 cm [[handgun]] mount, and twin 61 cm [[torpedo tubes]] on her left arm.

Often referred to as "Ooi-cchi" by [[Kitakami (Kancolle)|]]. Sometimes depicted as extremely Kitakami-sexual.

title: haruna_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Haruna[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Touyama Nao]].

She has [[long hair|long]] dull [[black_hair|black]]/[[grey hair]] (with an often forgotten [[hairclip]]), and [[brown eyes]]. All of the Kongou-class wear a [[nontraditional miko|modified miko]] uniform with differently colored [[skirt|skirts]] (hers is [[red skirt|red]]), [[thigh boots]], and wear the same signature winged [[hairband]]. 

She refers to herself in the third-person and has a warm, humble personality. Her famous line "Haruna is alright!" has earned her the nickname "daijoubu" and its own pool: pool #9955

title: pulling_another's_clothes
body:
Pulling down someone else's clothing, usually to expose their private parts. Do not use for clothing that is being lifted up, pulled to the side, or grabbed to get their attention.

This tag should always be used in conjunction with another [[clothes pull]] tag, such as [[panty pull]], [[skirt pull]], [[shirt pull]], etc. 

When the clothing being pulled exposes intimate/genital areas, also tag [[assisted exposure]].

title: nibelungenlied
body:
'The Nibelungenlied, translated as The Song of the Nibelungs, is an epic poem in Middle High German. The story tells of dragon-slayer [[Siegfried (Nibelungenlied)|]] at the court of the Burgundians, how he was murdered, and of his wife [[Kriemhild_(Nibelungenlied)|Kriemhild's]] revenge.'

title: bunnicula
body: Bunnicula is an American animated television series from Warner Bros. Animation developed by Jessica Borutski, produced by Borutski and Maxwell Atoms, and broadcast by [[Cartoon Network]] and Boomerang. The show is loosely based on the children's book series of the same name by James and Deborah Howe. It is a dark comedy about a [[vampire]] rabbit named Bunnicula who drinks carrot juice instead of blood to strengthen his super abilities in new paranormal adventures.

title: camp_lazlo
body: Camp Lazlo is an American animated television series created by Joe Murray for [[Cartoon Network]]. The series follows Lazlo, an anthropomorphic spider monkey who goes to a camp called "Camp Kidney", a Boy Scout–like summer camp in the Pimpleback Mountains. Lazlo resides in the "Jelly Bean" cabin with his fellow Bean Scouts; Raj, an Indian elephant, and Clam, a pygmy [[rhinoceros]]. Lazlo is often at odds with his pessimistic camp leader, Scoutmaster Lumpus the moose, but usually gets along well with the second-in-command, Slinkman the banana slug, and other campers. Camp Kidney sits just across the lake from Acorn Flats, which is home to the campsite of the all-female Squirrel Scouts (which function somewhat similarly to the Girl Scouts).

title: kibou_no_chikara_~otona_precure_'23~
body:
Spin-off sequel [[Precure]] anime, one of the Precure 20th anniversary celebration projects, featuring the characters from [[Yes! Precure 5]] and [[Futari wa Precure Splash Star]] [spoilers]and later [[Futari wa Precure Max Heart]][/spoilers] as adults. It's the first ever season to be made with the adult fans as the target audience, thus the first season to air in the evening instead of morning. It's also the first season to be a seasonal anime instead of an annual anime, having only 12 episodes.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Power_of_Hope:_PreCure_Full_Bloom
other_names: キボウノチカラ〜オトナプリキュア‘23〜

title: wonderful_precure!
body:
The twenty-first installment of the [[Precure]] franchise, released in 2024. The title is actually a pun, with the [i]won[/i] part of [i]Wonderful[/i] written as [i]wan[/i] in Japanese, which is also the Japanese onomatopoeia for a dog's barking.

Animal Town is a town where animals and people live together.
Iroha loves animals and is good friends with her dog, Komugi!
One day, a mysterious monster, Garugaru wreaks havoc in the town!
However, in order to protect Iroha, Komugi transformed into a human and became a Pretty Cure...!?
Komugi has to save the child animal whose heart is being garugaru-ed...!
Let's join forces and return the animals to the Niko Garden!

title: star_twinkle_precure
body:
Sixteenth installment of the [[Precure]] franchise, released in 2019.

Hikaru meets aliens Lala, Prunce, and Fuwa while watching the night sky. She learns of the "Star Palace," where the 12 Star Princesses of the constellations kept the balance of the universe until they were attacked. Lala is searching for the legendary Precure warriors to help find the 12 scattered "Princess Star Color Pens" and revive the princesses. When Fuwa is captured by an enemy, Hikaru wishes to save Fuwa, and a Star Color Pendant and a Star Color Pen appear to allow her to transform into Cure Star. From then on she works to collect the pens and raise Fuwa, who is the key to reviving the princesses.

title: futari_wa_precure_splash_star
body:
The very first spin-off from [[Futari wa Precure]], borrowing many concepts from the first series. The only Cures in this spin-off are [[Hyuuga Saki]] and [[Mishou Mai]], who transform into [[Cure Bloom]] and [[Cure Egret]] respectively, and later upgrade into [[Cure Bright]] and [[Cure Windy]]. They battle the forces of Dark Fall, who want to take over the World Tree by capturing seven fountains that nourish it.

title: romance_of_the_three_kingdoms
body:
[b]Romance of the Three Kingdoms[/b] is a Chinese historical novel attributed to "Luo Guanzhong":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luo_Guanzhong] detailing the history and folklore behind the period from 184 (The Yellow Turban Rebellion) to 280 (The unification of China by Jin) while passing through, among other things; the Battle of Chibi (208), the formation of the Three Kingdoms (years 220, 221 and 229), and the fall of Shu as well as the takeover of Wei by Jin (263-265).

The novel and the various individual stories within have a mind-boggingly high number of adaptations in every media and they have inspired many other stories involving the characters.

This tag is for either historical references to the Three Kingdoms period of [[China]], or romanticized depictions of the events and characters from the novel. 

h4. See also

* [[Ikkitousen]]
* [[Koihime Musou]]
* [[Player Na Wa]]
* [[Sangokushi Taisen]]
* [[Shin Sangoku Musou]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Romance of the Three Kingdoms":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romance_of_the_Three_Kingdoms]

title: longpao
body:
Dragon robes were the everyday dress of the emperors or kings of China (since the Tang dynasty), Korea (Goryeo and Joseon dynasties), Vietnam (Nguyễn dynasty) and the Ryukyu Kingdom.

They are very diverse in style (they can be [[zhijupao]], [[yuanlingpao]], [[yesa robe]] etc), but always include a dragon. 

h4. See also

* [[Mian guan]]

title: ana_(overwatch)
body:
A hero in [[Overwatch]]. [[Pharah_(overwatch)|Pharah's]] mother. A Support hero, she uses her sniper rifle to heal targets from far away, as well as being able to put enemies to sleep. Her conversations with other characters show that they nearly all consider her the Team Mom, and all of her quotes are likewise very motherly.

VA: Mia Soteriou (English), [[Sakakibara Yoshiko|Yoshiko Sakakibara]] (Japanese), Olga Hnidey (Latin American Spanish)

Ana was added to [[Overwatch 1]] on July 16, 2016.

title: yuanlingpao
body:
Yuanlingpao (圆领袍, round collar gown) is a type of round-collared garment in the traditional [[chinese_clothes|Chinese clothing]] known as [[hanfu]].

Yuanlingpao was adapted in every countries within the sinosphere: Korea, Japan and Vietnam. Unless altered in a recognizably Korean, Japanese or Vietnamese manner it is still considered Chinese hanfu. 

Dont use tags like [[hanbok]] or [[kimono]] for yuanlingpao, even if located in one of the corresponding locations.

title: nazrin
body:
The "Little Dowser General". Stage 1 mid-boss and boss, as well as Stage 5 mid-boss of [[Touhou]]'s [[Undefined Fantastic Object]].

A [[mouse girl|mouse]] youkai who can seek lost objects with her [[dowsing rod]]s, as well as the leader of a pack of [[mouse (animal)|mice]]. She is a direct subordinate of [[Toramaru Shou]], although not (until later) a follower of Shou's master [[Hijiri Byakuren]]. Doujinshi sometimes comically portray her being chased by [[Kaenbyou Rin]], [[Chen]], and/or [[Goutokuji Mike]] on account of their species. 

h4. Appearance
* !asset #23343446

She has [[mouse ears]] and a [[mouse tail]] with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[red eyes]]. Her outfit is a [[grey vest]] [[skirt set|and]] [[grey skirt]] with a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], sometimes a [[grey capelet]], a [[necklace]] with a [[crystal]] [[pendant]], [[white socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. Her mouse is usually in a [[holding basket|basket]] [[holding with tail|on her tail]].

h4. See also
* Pool #11329 - Shou's Missing Pagoda - Wanted by Nazrin or Shou, usually found in unusual places.
* [[Nazrin Day]] (20th July)

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Nazrin":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Nazrin

title: china
body:
On Danbooru, "China" refers to the [b]People's Republic of China[/b], otherwise known as mainland China, as well as the broader cultural and political idea of China.

States outside of Mainland China or nominally separate nations, tags such as [[Taiwan]] for the Republic of China, and [[Hong Kong]] or [[Macau]] may be used.

For the material that is sometimes known as china, see [[porcelain]].

title: rogamo
body:
A street food originating from the cuisine of Shaanxi Province in [[China]]. Literally meaning 'meat sandwich', it is minced meat, either beef or lamb, stuffed inside a piece of folded up flatbread, traditionally baked inside of a clay oven.

The term "rogamo" (otherwise spelled as rougamo or roujiamo) means "Chinese hamburger stuffed with meat". When you split the flatbread (shao bing) and add ingredients, it is called "rogamo". "Rogamo" refers to stuffed with meat, while "caigamo" refers to stuffed with vegetables. There are also variations like "liangpi gamo", "potato slice gamo", "huagan gamo", and so on.

In the game [[Genshin Impact]], the "[[Mora Meat (genshin_impact)|]]" food is a type of ”Rogamo”.

h4. See also
* [[Chinese food]]
* [[sandwich]]

[[Genshin Impact]] adapts this dish into the [[Lotus Flower Crisp (Genshin impact)|]].

title: pigeon-toed
body:
Toes point inwards when [[standing]], [[sitting]], or [[walking]]. Pigeon toes are also called in-toeing,  often caused by genu valgum, or "knock-knee".

Knock-knee can be tagged as [[knees together feet apart]]. It's a medical condition that the knees are bent inwards causing the calves to be unaturally spaced out, while the thighs are closer.

So there may be overlap between the two tags, but not all knock-knees show pigeon toes, and not all pigeon toes show knock-knees. 

h4.  See also 

* [[knees together feet apart]]
* [[Tag group:Posture]]

title: waluigi_(super_rush)
body:
[[Waluigi]] wearing his attire from [i][[Mario Golf: Super Rush]][/i]. This outfit consists of:

* [b]Headwear[/b]: A purple fedora with white band around it, adorned with a red rose on the side.
* [b]Top[/b]: A snazzy, golf-inspired outfit. A striped, long-sleeve shirt (vertical gray-and-white stripes) is worn underneath. Over the shirt, he wears a purple vest with gold-colored buttons. The vest is slim-fitting, with a V-neck that reveals the shirt collar and stripes.
* [b]Glove[/b]: A single purple-and-white golf glove.
* [b]Botttoms[/b]: Matching purple trousers continue the color scheme, fitting rather snugly.
* [b]Footwear[/b]: His golf shoes are predominantly purple and white, tying in with the rest of his outfit. They have cleats and resemble [[saddle shoes]].

title: hoshino_akira
body:
An [[original|original character]] by [[Miyamoto Issa]]. She is one of the main female protagonists in their trilogy [[doujinshi]], Heart Mark Oome.

She is a friend of Yuu's who likes anime and manga, she also learns that his [[Saigawara Reika|sister]] is an ero-manga artist whom she's a fan of. She soon has [[sex]] with Yuu, and joins in [[threesome]]s with him and his sister.

[b]Akira[/b] has [[dark skin]], [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

body:
[[Princess Peach]] wearing her attire from [i]Mario Golf: Toadstool Tour[/i]. This outfit consists of:

* [b]Dress[/b]: A sleeveless pink dress. The bottom hem of the dress features a decorative scalloped pattern.
* [b]Legwear[/b]: White socks that come up just above her ankles (nearly mid‐calf).
* [b]Footwear[/b]: Red shoes with a pink toe cap.

Notably, this outfit has extensive use outside of its debut game, appearing in [i][[Mario Power Tennis]][/i], [i]SSX on Tour[/i], [i][[Mario Golf: World Tour]][/i], and many other spin-off titles.

title: back_to_the_future
body: A franchise centering around the adventures of [[Marty McFly]] as he travels through time in the fictional California town of Hill Valley using a time machine in the form of a [[DeLorean]]. Popular since the first installment of its film trilogy was released in 1985 and became the year's highest-grossing movie, its cast includes Michael J. Fox as Marty and Christopher Lloyd as [[Emmett Brown|Dr. Emmett "Doc" Brown]], the time machine's inventor.
other_names: バック・トゥ・ザ・フューチャー
バックトゥザフューチャー

title: back_to_the_future_part_ii
body:
The 1989 sequel to the 1985 film [[Back to the Future]] and the second installment in the Back to the Future franchise.

It follows [[Marty McFly]] and his friend [[Emmett Brown|Dr. Emmett "Doc" Brown]] as they travel from 1985 to 2015 to prevent Marty's son from sabotaging the McFly family's future. When their arch-nemesis [[Biff Tannen]] steals Doc's [[DeLorean]] [[time machine]] and uses it to alter history for his benefit, the duo must return to 1955 to restore the timeline.
other_names: バック・トゥ・ザ・フューチャー2
バックトゥザフューチャー2

title: back_to_the_future_part_iii
body: Back to the Future Part III is a 1990 American science fiction Western film and the third installment of the [[Back to the Future]] trilogy. The film was directed by Robert Zemeckis, and stars Michael J. Fox, Christopher Lloyd, Mary Steenburgen, Thomas F. Wilson, and Lea Thompson. The film continues immediately following [[Back to the Future Part II]] (1989).
other_names: バック・トゥ・ザ・フューチャーPART3

title: rozen_maiden
body:
A manga by the group [[PEACH-PIT]], with an anime series of the same name. It deals obliquely with the pressures placed on children in Japan by telling the story of a student, Jun Sakurada, who cracked under the strain. The series chronicles Jun's reluctant mental recovery through experiences with the Rozen Maiden, a series of enchanted dolls tasked with fighting each other and taking their life force known as the Rosa Mystica, in a process called the Alice Game.

title: princess_peach_(tennis_64)
body:
[[Princess Peach]] wearing her attire from the Nintendo 64 video game [[Mario Tennis (Nintendo 64)|Mario Tennis]]. This outfit consists of:

* [b]Dress[/b]: A short pink dress with puffy short sleeves. There’s a lighter pink shade that makes up the main part of the skirt and a darker pink band or trim around her waist area.
* [b]Jewels[/b]: A large, round blue jewel in the center of her chest, matching her round blue earrings.
* [b]Legwear[/b]: White socks that come up to about mid-calf.
* [b]Footwear[/b]: Orange tennis shoes with a thin band near the soles.

title: gundam_barbatos
body:
[b]ASW-G-08 Gundam Barbatos [/b]

The mascot [[mecha|mech]] of [[gundam tekketsu no orphans|Gundam Iron-Blooded Orphans]]. Its signature weapon is a very large [[mace]].

Use this tag for the Gundam Barbatos and its in-story upgrades: the Gundam Barbatos Lupus, and the Gundam Barbatos Lupus Rex.

It is piloted by [[Mikazuki Augus]].
other_names: ガンダム・バルバトス

title: wing_gundam_fenice

title: gundam_kimaris_vidar
body:
[b]ASW-G-66 Gundam Kimaris Vidar[/b]
A refit of the mighty [[Gundam Kimaris]], increasing its power even further via the addition of a special Alaya-Vijnana System that enabled its pilot, the mysterious Vidar, to operate the machine to the fullest of its potential.

[spoiler]Utilizing the remains of [[Ein Dalton]]'s brain for control, this meant Vidar, aka [[Gaelio Bauduin]], was able to abuse the Alaya-Vijnana without incurring any damage to his brain - in fact, the implant ended up helping him with his disability.[/spoiler]
other_names: ガンダム・キマリスヴィダール

title: v2_gundam
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]] from 1993.

[b]LM314V21 Victory 2 Gundam[/b]

An upgraded version of the [[V Gundam]] incorporating the V2 Core Fighter, loaded with a powerful Minovsky drive capable of pushing the [[mobile suit]] to suicidal accelerations of up to 20G. 

The exhaust plumes of the Minovsky drive often were released as the "Wings of Light", which served both as deadly offensive weapons and absolute shields, and the unit itself could be fitted with extra hyper beam cannons, variable speed beam rifles, I-Field generators, and a mega beam shield using the Buster and Assault optional armament sets.
 
It could also load all of them at once, creating a new, almost invincible configuration known as the [b]LM314V23/24 [[V2 Assault-Buster Gundam]][/b]. It was piloted almost exclusively by the League Militaire's ace, [[Uso Ewin]].

title: east_japan_railway_company
body:
The East Japan Railway Company is a major passenger railway company in Japan, the largest of the seven [[Japan Railways]] Group companies. The company name is officially abbreviated as [[East Japan Railway Company|JR-EAST]] or [[East Japan Railway Company|JR East]] in English, and as [[East Japan Railway Company|JR Higashi-Nihon (JR東日本, Jeiāru Higashi-Nihon)]] in Japanese.

title: gundam_bael
body:
[b]ASW-G-01 Gundam Bael[/b]
The original Gundam Frame created during the Calamity War to fend off against the Mobile Armors. Bael was an all-round balanced MS that possessed no specific strengths nor weaknesses - however, after the war, its mighty symbolism among Gjallarhorn (it was assumed that Bael rejected commands and only the "righteous heir of Gjallarhorn" could successfully control the unit) meant that once it was obtained by [[McGillis Fareed]], who managed to pilot it, his political power grew exponentially.

title: ezo_red_fox_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park, being part of the Snowy Mountain Region in the anime.

As her name suggests, she is an [[Ezo Red Fox]] ([i]Vulpes vulpes schrencki[/i]), a red fox subspecies native to Hokkaido and Sakhalin.

Her outfit consists of what appears to be an orange blazer uniform with fur lined sleeves and a white pleated skirt, beige pantyhose fading to white at the feet, black gloves as well as a scarf tied into a bow. She has long blonde hair with black-tipped bangs along with the requisite fox ears and tail. She can be distinguished from a simple palette swap of Silver Fox with her lack of sidelocks. Her eyes are also a lighter amber color than her fellow fox.

More often than not, she is depicted as a slacker who likes to play video games.

She is often seen with [[Silver Fox (kemono friends)|]], a fellow fox Friend. Compare as well with [[Red Fox (kemono friends)|]], their nominate species Friend.
other_names: キタキツネ(けものフレンズ)

title: shoebill_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park, being part of the Prairie Region.

[[Shoebill]]s ([i]Balaeniceps rex[/i]) are stork-like birds known for - as their names suggest - their shoe-shaped beaks.

h5.Appearance
* [[long hair|Long]] [[multicolored hair]] consisting of [[grey hair|grey]], [[black hair|black]], and light [[orange hair|orange]]
* Hair is fashioned with a [[sidelocks|lock of hair]] on her left side that resembles a shoebill's beak.
* Her [[bangs]] form a neat point [[hair_between_eyes|between her eyes]], partially occluding them and exaggerating [[tsurime|her piercing gaze]].
* Has [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[bird wings]] [[head wings|on her head]] and a [[bird tail]]
* She appears to be wearing either a unitard or a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[grey shirt]] with [[grey shorts]]
* Has a [[grey necktie|grey]] or [[white necktie]] and [[belt]] while her outfit has many [[pocket]]s
* [[black gloves|Black]] [[fingerless gloves]]
* Please note that she's wearing a silver [[bodystocking]] under her outfit and not just [[pantyhose]]
other_names: ハシビロコウ(けものフレンズ)

body:

For the suspended form which often runs above streets, see [[cable car]] or [[suspension railway]].

title: enoshima_electric_railway
body:
The Enoshima Electric Railway or Enoshima Dentetsu Line (江ノ島電鉄, Enoshima dentetsu), also known by the abbreviation Eno-den (江ノ電), is a Japanese railway which connects Kamakura Station in [[Kamakura (city)|]] with Fujisawa Station in Fujisawa, Kanagawa. Known for being the main railway access to the Sitting Buddha at Koutoku-in Temple (near Hase station), [[Enoshima]] island in Fujisawa, and the [[railroad crossing]] at Kamakura Koukou-mae station that directly faces the Pacific Ocean (as seen in [i][[Slam Dunk (series)|]][/i], [[Seishun Buta Yarou]] and [i][[Tari Tari]][/i]). 

H4. Logo
* !asset #23483570: Enoden Logo

h4. Example 
* !post #5811074: Enoden 1000 Series [[Streetcar]]
* !post #4392845: An Enoden [[Streetcar]] crossing Kamakura Koukou-mae [[railroad crossing]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enoshima_Electric_Railway]

title: pantograph
body:
An apparatus mounted on the roof of an [[electric locomotive]], [[streetcar]] or [[trolleybus]] to collect power through contact with an [[overhead line]].

For a type of drafting instrument, use [[pantograph linkage]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7205834: Single-arm pantograph
* !post #7393179: Double-arm, diamond-shaped
* !asset #23193908: ChS200 Electric Locomotive
* !asset #24921374: Use on Tolleybuses

h4. See also

* [[Electric Locomotive]]
* [[Train]]
* [[Tag Group:Technology]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Pantograph (transport)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pantograph_(transport)]

title: electric_locomotive
body:
A [[locomotive]] powered by electricity from a [[pantograph]] connected to an [[overhead line]], A Contact shoe connected to third rail (or fourth rail) or on-board energy storage such as a battery or a supercapacitor.

h4. Examples

* !post #8094486: [[Class EF66|EF66 Electric locomotive]]
* !asset #23137077: A Soviet Two-Unit Electric locomotive "VL80 "Vladimir Lenin" "
* !asset #23155900: Electric Shunter Locomotive Example 
* !asset #23193908: ChS200 Electric Locomotive 
* !asset #24921352: A Dual Mode (A [[Diesel Locomotive]] That can also change to an [[electric locomotive]]) Locomotive Using The third rail electrification system (on the left of the locomotive)
* !asset #23515870: Locomotora E-32: Bulldog Nose Design
* !asset #23519056: SBB Ce 6/8 II: A Krokodil Locomotive
